People sometimes say, “don’t judge a book by its cover” and even though we LOVE beautiful duvet covers at HomeChoice, what really matters when you’re looking for warm winter sleep is what’s inside the covers, not just what’s on top!
Click here to explore all our bedding basics
The best thing about winter sheets
What works for summer isn’t always best for the cold winter nights. Winter sheets feel warm against your skin as soon as you touch them, which means you don’t have to wait for them to heat up around your body before you fall asleep. They are also soft, fluffy and very comfortable. Traditionally, winter sheet sets are made from cotton flannel but HomeChoice also has them in even thicker, warmer polar fleece. You won’t find this anywhere else
The warmest duvet inners
Natural duvets include all sorts of fillings from cotton to camel hair, wool to kapok, but undoubtedly the warmest ones available are made from feathers or down.
The lowdown on down
Down is what we call the smallest, finest feathers on a duck or goose. They’re often tightly curled so they trap air and insulate heat. When people speak about feather duvets, the feathers used are flatter, longer and harder than down. They trap air but not as easily and they’re a lot heavier on the body.
What about my allergies?
In the past, feather and down duvets were as well known for their long-lasting quality, warmth and softness as for causing allergies. But today, they’re often treated against dust and other allergens so they can still be considered an option for allergy-sufferers. However, HomeChoice also stocks the Royal Danish Sheradown duvet inner – with a synthetic filler that feels just like real feathers and down. It’s completely hypoallergenic so it’s safer and j ust as luxurious.

I hope you’ve enjoyed my tips on keeping your bed extra warm from the inside, out. HomeChoice has all sorts of innovative ways to keep the cold out this winter, like 3-ply mink/sherpa blankets, fireplace heaters, thick jacquard bedding, stylish coats and fashionable boots. You’ll find it all, easy to order at homechoice.co.za
